reviews.text: When I checked in, it reminded me a lot of the Clift Hotel in San Francisco. My husband and I have been to W hotels all of the world. The SF and NY W's have more of contemporary, cozy and warm feelings, while the Clift is more modern, angular and trendy. The way the tables in the bar were set up to face the street reminded me of street cafe in Europe.
reviews.title: couldn't be happier, I had a wonderful time :)

reviews.text: I had some problems with my arms, and I had my puppy with me, and I was dressed pretty " down" - though I guess I did show up in a chauffeured car :) . But the staff was not judgmental at all.
reviews.title: A bit of a Soul-less experience

likes.liked: — Sound system in the room, Kitchen, funky elevators

reviews.text: They were so firendly and willing to help me. My husband wasn't with me, and I was kind of worried how I would handle all my luggage and the puppy and everthing. I've been to a lot of Korean hotels and I think many of them would have been judgmental and given me a hard time, but not this one !!!
reviews.title: Good experience

reviews.text: Which actually brings me to the one thing that wasn't great, which was that I had to carry my puppy all the way from the room until I was outside - which since my arms weren't in great shape was kind of hard.
reviews.title: Incredible!!!

reviews.text: But every time I interacted with the staff they were so pleasant and kind, that small detail really didn't bother me much.
reviews.title: W = WoW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just finished an over night stay at the W Seoul Walkerhill and must say I am very impressed. But, it almost started off very badly. I arrived at 2pm to check in and have some items placed in my room for my return later that evening. Unfortunately, my room was not ready yet and would not be ready for another hour. I left my bags with the front desk and said I would return later that evening. I received a phone call after I departed saying that another aspect of my reservation was not properly made and I would have more difficulties. The front desk put me on the phone with the manager and that is when the "whatever, whenever" attitude kicked in. The manager apologized sincerely and said that when I returned later that evening, I would be surprised. And boy was I ever; They gave me a free room upgrade (from fabulous to mega room), complimentary wine, chocolates, and a teddy bear, and additional candles and balloons to my original order (i ordered 6 candles and 10 balloons and got 15 candles and 30 balloons!). From that point the service was 5-star and the motto held true, whatever, whenever. Our room was setup perfectly, with the jacuzzi water already filled and at perfect temperature. The color scheme of the room mixed in with the wine, chocolates, room decorations, jacuzzi and breathtaking view made the evening one of the best romantic experiences I have ever had. Would stay at this hotel again and definitely recommend it to anyone seeking a romantic modern getaway from the craziness of downtown Seoul. 5 stars!
reviews.title: Started slow but finished big...

likes.disliked: — Cost was a bit high, but still we enjoyed everything.

reviews.text: From the moment we arrived till we left we said often Wow..
reviews.title: W hotel = WOW

likes.liked: — The design of the hotel is so nice...

reviews.text: The check in went quick and they even took a picture of us..later we understood how good that works because we had a little discussion about a trip to the DMZ.
reviews.title: We loved our Cool Corner Room

likes.liked: — stylish rooms, spa, service service service

reviews.text: That afternoon Mr. Park the manager came to us when we were in the restautant and asked if all went well and yes it went perfectly! So that is why they make a picture!
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: The hotel design is so nice if you like your room trendy..I am still speechless from the great yacuzzi in which we spent some time..
reviews.title: W = WoW

likes.liked: — More modern and cleaner than any other Seoul hotel I've visited

reviews.text: Spent 2 great days at the W Walkerhill. The level of service from the staff was extraordinary. We were using Starwood points for the stay and received a complimentary upgrade to a fantastic room with a river view. Breakfast buffet was extensive and very good.
reviews.title: Two great days

reviews.text: It's easy to get to the Walkerhill on one of the KAL buses which leave Inchon airport and go right to the front door of the hotel. A free shuttle bus will take you from the hotel to the closest subway stop on the easy-to-use Seoul subway system.
reviews.title: Great for a cool weekend

likes.disliked: — Long trek from airport and into city

reviews.text: Stayed there this weekend with a friend and loved the room, ambience and servcie standards.
reviews.title: Party Like a Rock Star!
The "Wonderful" room really was!
reviews.text: Room really funky with Bose sounds systems, large TV and rain shower bathroom etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bar and reception area is fab with chilled DJ in the evening and loads of sofas, cushions, egg pod chairs to be lounged on day or night.
reviews.title: Better to see it from afar than to stay in it

reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights in a "Wonderful" room this week and it was fantastic. The rooms seem quite like anywhere else.. only they are not. It's all heavily pushed towards design, but there's a lot of substance to it, too. I'd say the room is a bit complicated at first, with heaps of buttons everywhere. I felt like a Flintstone. But after the first 20mins toying with the remotes, it was all good, really good. Loved the Bose cd-player. Loved the white & red. Loved the lobby.
reviews.title: "Wow"-ed a lot

reviews.text: I guess one would eventually tire of the W concept if it were all about overwhelming with design and cool. But they have followed the concept through with the superb and friendly approach they have to service. It's all smiles and good fun, and staff are very well trained and utterly in touch with what's going on in Seoul.
reviews.title: Wonderful and Freindly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only true drawback is location. Wonderful views across the river, but in Seoul proximity to the subway is anyone's lifeline. Taxi are hell in Seoul because of traffic and distance to the City Hall and University areas is huge.
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience

reviews.text: However, it's totally recommended to stay here at least once.
reviews.title: Outstanding View in the Lap of Luxury

likes.disliked: — The spa is not that great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Usually I can't afford to stay in the W but found a great rate so of course took advantage. As my expectations were high, I still manged to get pleasantly surprised. The room and the ambiance was great which is what I was expecting but what shocked me was how great the staff was. As a constant business traveler I see many hotels, but the friendliness of the staff was extra good which made it one of the best hotel experiences I have had in recent memory.
reviews.title: Fabulous room and hotel!!

likes.liked: — Room with Jacuzzi and fantastic view.
